author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: B.C. provincial authorities say the province’s coast is not at risk after a 7.8 magnitude earthquake struck near Russia’s Kamchatka Peninsula around noon Pacific Time on Sept. 18. The earthquake struck about 9.6 kilometres under the water, around 410 kilometres southwest of Bering Island, Russia, prompting tsunami warnings for Alaska’s Aleutian Islands and the Amchitka […]
title: BC Coast Faces No Tsunami Threat After 7.8-Magnitude Earthquake Near Russia: Emergency Office

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Liberal government is seeking $198,000 in damages from the company behind the ArriveCan app scandal, according to government records. Conservative MP Larry Brock filed an Inquiry of Ministry in June to ask about the Canadian government’s lawsuits against GC Strategies, the company behind the ArriveCAN app that was used during the COVID-19 pandemic to […]
title: Ottawa Requests $200,000 in Damages Following $64 Million ArriveCan Scandal

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Public Safety Minister Gary Anandasangaree says the Ontario Provincial Police (OPP) has refused to participate in the Liberal government’s gun buyback program. “The OPP has indicated that they will not participate directly,” Anandasangaree told reporters ahead of a caucus meeting on Sept. 17. “As you know, they represent 26 percent of the overall policing in […]
title: OPP Refuses to Participate in Gun Buyback Program, Public Safety Minister Says

author: Chandra Philip
description: The U.S. ambassador to Canada thanked those who attended a vigil in Calgary held in honour of conservative American influencer Charlie Kirk. Kirk, who co-founded the national conservative student organization Turning Point USA in 2012, was shot on Sept. 10 at Utah Valley University. He was holding a speaking event on campus at the time. […]
title: US Ambassador Thanks Calgary Kirk Vigil Attendees for ‘Standing With Us’

author: Tom Ozimek
description: U.S. officials urged Aleutian residents to move inland after a 7.8 earthquake struck near Kamchatka and triggered tsunami alerts.
title: Tsunami Advisory Issued for Alaska’s Aleutian Islands After Powerful Quake Off Russia

author: Catherine Yang
description: 'It’s a very difficult situation,' Pope Leo XIV said.
title: Pope Listening to Persecuted Catholics, Signals Potential Change to China Deal

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Former Transport Minister Chrystia Freeland will again appear before a parliamentary committee following a unanimous vote by its members, after new emails appear to reveal her department was aware weeks in advance that BC Ferries intended to use a $1 billion loan from the Canada Infrastructure Bank (CIB) to help purchase four vessels from a […]
title: Freeland Recalled to Testify at Committee Amid Revelations of Transport’s Prior Notice of BC Ferries Loan

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: A nationwide warrant has been issued by Toronto police for a city resident wanted for first-degree murder in the weekend shooting death of 43-year-old Paulin Harusha. Toronto police responded to reports of a shooting in the Victoria Park Avenue and Sheppard Avenue E. area of Toronto just before midnight on Sept. 13, according to a […]
title: Toronto Police Launch Canada-Wide Manhunt in Homicide Case

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Airborne Exercise in Netherlands, Protests in France, and Spider Monkeys

author: The Canadian Press
description: Canada Post is sending new offers to the Canadian Union of Postal Workers in an effort to move negotiations forward, the postal service said Thursday. The new terms will allow the two sides to return to the bargaining table next week, with work already underway to make that happen, the Crown corporation said. The move […]
title: Canada Post Sending New Offers to Union With Aim of Moving Talks Forward

author: Lee Hall
description: NTD’s Lee Hall sits down with barrister, legal commentator, and constitutional expert Steven Barrett to discuss fixing what Barrett believes to be Britain’s bloated laws and rebuilding trust in our legal system. Barrett talks about two-tier justice, Fabian influence on Britain, and why civil justice is becoming less accessible to ordinary Brits.
title: To Fix Britain, We Need to Take Back Control of Our Legal System: Steven Barrett

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Ottawa is set to table a new hate crime bill on Sept. 19 that is expected to make it a criminal offence to intentionally promote hate in public by using “terror” and “hate” symbols. The new legislation would target symbols of government-designated terror groups and other hate symbols, such as Nazi, Hamas, or Hezbollah flags, […]
title: What the New Hate Crime Bill Could Look Like

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Ottawa is asking the Supreme Court of Canada to set limits on the manner in which provincial governments can use a controversial clause in the Charter of Rights and Freedoms. Section 33 of the Charter, known as the Notwithstanding clause, permits provincial governments to override specific provisions of the Charter by enacting a law, which […]
title: What’s the Controversy Around Ottawa Wanting to Limit Use of Notwithstanding Clause?

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Former Justice Minister David Lametti has been appointed Canada’s ambassador to the United Nations, the Prime Minister’s Office announced, while a number of former Trudeau cabinet members and current Liberal MPs are reportedly set to be appointed to diplomatic positions in the near future. The PMO confirmed in a statement on Sept. 18 that former […]
title: Lametti Named Canada’s UN Ambassador, While Reports Say Other Top Trudeau-Era Ministers to Be Given Diplomatic Posts

author: Stuart Liess
description: Known as the 'Birthplace of Rock 'n' Roll,' Memphis is ranked as having the highest violent crime rate in the United States.
title: Trump Sends Troops to Memphis

author: Chandra Philip
description: Police in Regina have arrested and charged two men with several offences, including attempted murder after an 11-year-old girl was shot in Saskatchewan’s capital city. The charges are linked to an early morning incident on Aug. 11, Regina Police Service said in a press release. Officers responded to a call from a home at approximately […]
title: 2 Men Charged With Attempted Murder After 11-Year-Old Shot in Regina: Police

author: Rachel Roberts
description: A federal judge has overturned a state judge ruling that the deportation of a prominent organizer of the Columbia University protests is unlawful .
title: Judge Rules Pro-Palestinian Activist Mahmoud Khalil Should be Deported

author: The Canadian Press
description: The Conservatives have introduced a private members’ bill in the House of Commons that would make the murder of an intimate partner a first-degree crime. Conservative public safety critic Frank Caputo says the bill would treat such crimes the way the Criminal Code currently treats the murder of a peace officer. Caputo told a press […]
title: Conservatives Table Bill to Make Murdering an Intimate Partner a First-Degree Crime

author: The Canadian Press
description: Vaccines against COVID-19 will no longer be free of charge to the general population in Quebec starting this fall. The province’s Health Department confirmed the new policy in an email today. Only certain people will remain eligible for subsidized shots, including those with chronic health conditions, those over 65, and health-care workers. The department says […]
title: Quebec to Stop Offering COVID Vaccine for Free to Most People, Shots Cost up to $180

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: A 75-year-old former swim instructor is facing more than 60 charges associated with alleged sex crimes involving 30 young people over a 26-year period at a Nova Scotia corrections facility. The Nova Scotia RCMP have laid 66 charges against Dartmouth resident Donald Douglas Williams following a multi-year investigation into alleged sexual assaults that occurred at […]
title: Ex-Swim Instructor at Nova Scotia Juvenile Facility Charged With 66 Sexual Offences

author: The Canadian Press
description: Sault Ste. Marie, Ont., and the Hamilton Oshawa Port Authority have signed a partnership to develop a trade corridor connecting northern and southern Ontario. The corridor is expected to include integrated rail, highway, and marine links with extended-season service. The partners say the plan will be anchored by a newly developed port in Sault Ste. […]
title: Trade Corridor Partnership Connecting Northern and Southern Ontario Announced

author: Ryan Morgan
description: The United States had withdrawn its troops from Bagram in the summer of 2021, shortly before the collapse of the U.S.-backed Afghan government.
title: US Seeking to Regain Control of Bagram Air Base in Taliban-Controlled Afghanistan: Trump

author: Owen Evans
description: The 'Bloquons Tout' movement continues to bring France to a halt with protests over major government spending cuts.
title: France Hit by Second Wave of Strikes in ‘Block Everything’ Movement

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: A provincial task force has been established in British Columbia to respond to the rising number of extortion threats and shootings targeting the South Asian community. The task force announced by the province on Sept. 17 comes in response to several  homes and businesses being sprayed with bullets. Dozens of threats, and some of the […]
title: BC Forms Task Force to Address Extortion and Shootings in South Asian Community

author: Guy Birchall
description: Warsaw's energy minister's comments were made just days after multiple Russian drones entered Polish airspace.
title: Poland Calls on EU to End Russian Oil Imports by 2026 Amid Hungarian, Slovak Objections

author: Frank Fang
description: Lai, a British citizen, has been imprisoned in Hong Kong since December 2020.
title: Senators Urge UK, US to Help Secure Release of Hong Kong Democracy Activist Jimmy Lai

author: The Canadian Press
description: The federal broadcast regulator begins a hearing today to look at which Canadian content obligations should apply to music streamers like Spotify. Streaming services argue their current efforts to promote Canadian culture—and the royalties they pay—are good enough. Radio broadcasters, meanwhile, say their sector is in serious decline and they want the CRTC to take […]
title: CRTC Launches Hearing on Canadian Content Obligations for Music Streamers

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The ABC says it has been told that the matter was unrelated to an earlier exchange between Trump and its Americas editor.
title: Australia’s Public Broadcaster Not Attending Trump-UK Press Conference

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Under the deal, any attack on one country will be treated as an attack on both, in what leaders called a commitment to 'joint deterrence against aggression.'
title: Saudi Arabia, Nuclear-Armed Pakistan Sign Mutual Defense Pact

author: Chris Summers
description: 'The E3 reiterated the urgency and their determination to move ahead with the reimposition of sanctions absent concrete actions,' German Foreign Ministry said.
title: Iran Has Not Taken Actions Needed to Prevent UN Nuclear Sanctions, European Officials Say

author: Reuters
description: RIO DE JANEIRO—Doctors for former President Jair Bolsonaro said Wednesday that they detected early-stage cancer in skin lesions removed from the 70-year-old politician. Bolsonaro went to the DF Star hospital Sunday to have eight lesions removed for testing, and again on Tuesday because of vomiting and low blood pressure before being released Wednesday. Results showed […]
title: Doctors for Brazil’s Bolsonaro Say Early-Stage Cancer Detected in His Skin Lesions

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The state government says the move is a 'tough blow for workers.'
title: Anglo American to Cut More Than 200 Queensland Jobs After Company Review

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: Microbes, some of them consisting of a single cell, shape ecosystems, produce food, regulate disease, and might even help repair the Great Barrier Reef.
title: Big Plans for the Smallest Creatures: Australian University to Play Key Conservation Role

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Net overseas migration has fallen for a sixth straight quarter, easing well below Treasury forecasts.

description: 'The science and the climate change rapidly. New information comes to light almost every day,' said Monash University professor Christian Jakob.

description: Thousands have signed a petition calling for her to be reinstated.
title: Psychologist Who Questioned Puberty Blockers Terminated by Queensland Health

description: Senior members say it’s only a matter of time before a fatality occurs if new trucks and equipment are not rolled out.
title: Why Victorian Firefighters Say They’re Fighting Fires Without Water

author: Chandra Philip
description: Nearly 40 percent of Canadian youth say unemployment is their top concern, according to a new poll. The survey was conducted by the Angus Reid Institute. It found that nearly two in five of those between 18 years and 24 years (37 percent) said jobs and unemployment was the top issue facing the country. That […]
title: 40 Percent of Canadian Youth Say Jobs a Major Concern: Poll

author: AAP
description: More than a dozen allegations against the 84-year-old radio veteran were abandoned.
title: Prosecutors Withdraw More Than a Dozen Sex Abuse Charges Against Alan Jones

author: Chandra Philip
description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith has asked her jobs minister to use “all legal means” to give the province more control over international immigration. Smith made the request in a new mandate letter issued to Minister of Jobs, Economy, Trade and Immigration Joseph Schow, who shared it on social media. The letter said Alberta wants a “more […]
title: Alberta’s Smith Directs Jobs Minister to Seek More Provincial Control Over Immigration

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Kmart’s use of facial recognition to stop refund fraud was ruled unlawful, with the Privacy Commissioner calling it 'disproportionate' surveillance.

description: Santos says the consortium would not abide by conditions it felt would protect shareholders.

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Explainer Prime Minister Mark Carney announced his government’s Build Canada Homes (BCH) initiative on Sept. 14, with some details released and others still undetermined. With $13 billion in federal funding to start, BCH aims to construct an initial set of 4,000 units across six federally-owned sites in Dartmouth, N.S.; Longueuil, Que.; Ottawa; Toronto; Winnipeg, Man.; […]
title: What We Know So Far About the Federal Government’s $13 Billion Housing Project

author: Monica O’Shea
description: 'There's potential for digital ID to be used,' Shadow Communications Minister Melissa McIntosh said.
title: Digital ID Concerns Emerge Ahead of Australia’s Under 16 Social Media Ban

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The 2 million Canadians set to renew their mortgages soon will see only modest relief after the Bank of Canada slashed interest rates for the first time since March, with real estate experts also warning housing affordability will remain relatively unchanged. Bank of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem announced on Sept. 17 that it would lower […]
title: What the Rate Cut Means for Mortgage Rates and the Real Estate Market
